info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 1:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN COLFAX COUNTY THROUGH 200 PM MDT... At 130 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cimarron Canyon State Park, or 25 miles northeast of Taos, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Angel Fire, Eagle Nest, Cimarron Canyon State Park, Vietnam Veterans Memorial State Park, Eagle Nest Lake State Park and Ute Park. This includes the following highways... Highway 64 between Mile Markers 274 and 301. State Road 434 between Mile Markers 34 and 36. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches.
